intro: Androsace wiedemannii, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Androsace wiedemannii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in cool, moist conditions.
